(switch ; We don't care if an object ascends or enters a stargate
(or (= aDestroyReason 'ascended) (= aDestroyReason 'enteredStargate)) Nil

Events.OnGlobalSystemStarted:
(switch ; If not in C5, then nothing to do
(!= (sysGetNode) 'C5) Nil
; If we don't have a mission to meet Sandoval, then ; there's nothing to do.
(not (msnCanCreate &msFindHandOfSolace;)) Nil

; Tell the player and set the target
(objSendMessage gPlayerShip sandovalObj (msnTranslate gSource 'msgFoundWreck)) (msnSetData gSource 'foundWreck True) (msnSetPlayerTarget gSource)

(shpCancelOrders sandovalObj) (shpOrder sandovalObj 'dock wreckObj) )

Language.Text: Chapter 5: The Hand of Solace

Fiona has asked you to team up with Hugo Sandoval to find the wreckage of the Hand of Solace. She hopes that the wreckage will help to unravel the mystery of its destruction, and reveal its connection to the attack on Fiona.
Follow Sandoval and help him scan for the wreckage of the Hand of Solace. Do not enter or let anyone enter the scanning zone.
System: %systemName%\n Payment: None

With Sandoval and Benedict's help, you extract a course-log from the drive computer of the doomed Hand of Solace. Sandoval takes the data to Fiona for decoding in hopes that it will reveal the ultimate cause of its destruction.
Meanwhile, Benedict heads towards the Sisters' capital in the Sanctuary system to see if they can help. Meet him there if you wish to help him.
System: %systemName%\n Payment: None

You have failed. Fiona asked you to team up with Hugo Sandoval to find the wreckage of the Hand of Solace and search for clues.
But now Sandoval is dead and you've lost any hope of finding the Hand of Solace.
No further progress on this storyline is possible.
System: %systemName%\n Payment: None

Sandoval shakes his head and puts his blaster away.
"So you're Fiona's new pet? Well, I expected someone taller."

Sandoval shakes his head and puts his blaster away.
"So you're Fiona's new pet? Well, I'm not disappointed."

"All business, eh? Just like Fiona! OK, let's get to work!
"We're looking for a tiny wreck in an entire star system. Not my favorite job, by far. But I've got enough equipment here to do it. I'll be able to pick up even the faintest radiation."
"Nothing's easy, kid. We'll be scanning right in the middle of marauder territory, and we're going to be attracting a lot of attention."

"I'm sure you can. But here's the trick: a gunship engine belching hot plasma is going to blind the scanner, right?
You'll have to keep all ships away from me until I'm done scanning."
"You ready now? Armor all clean? Weapons loaded? Do you need a hug before we go?"

"You're not as fun as I expected.
"Remember, keep all ships away from me until I'm done scanning. It's our best chance to find the Hand of Solace."
Language.String: "Alright. Follow me to the search area."
"As much as I would enjoy your visit, we've got work to do."

(block ( (missionObj (@ (msnFind "a +unid:&msFindHandOfSolace;;") 0)) (sandovalObj (objGetObjByID (msnGetData missionObj 'sandovalID))) ) (switch ; If no mission object, then go to standard loot screen
(not missionObj) (scrShowScreen gScreen &dsAbandonedShip;)
; If Sandoval is dead, we go to special text without Sandoval ; [This can't happen because the mission fails if Sandoval is dead.]
(not sandovalObj) (scrSetData gScreen 'dialogTree 'dlgBenedictAlone)
; If Sandoval has not yet docked, then wait for him
(!= (objGetProperty sandovalObj 'dockedAtID) (objGetID gSource)) (scrSetData gScreen 'dialogTree 'dlgWaitForSandoval)
; Otherwise, we go to the normal screen
(scrSetData gScreen 'dialogTree 'dlgHandOfSolace) ) )

Language.Text: You decide to wait for Sandoval.

Benedict pulls some data our of the propulsion system.
"Sandoval is dead, so it's just the two of us. I'll take this data to Sanctuary. Meet me there!"

You board the medical ship behind Sandoval and are immediately confronted by an armored figure. He opens his helmet.
It's Benedict.

"Fiona was attacked before she could find this wreck. This is what they were trying to keep her from seeing."
He looks at Sandoval, arm cannon ready.
"But I guess you already know that. Hello, Sandoval."

Sandoval nods with a smirk and casually shows his empty hands.
"I'm impressed, Benedict. I guess you're not just a mindless gun."

"No. Everything's been wiped: computers, logs, comms records. Everything.
"There was definite fighting. The hull's covered in laser scars and blast damage. The reactor's scrammed and useless. No bodies, of course. Everything's clean."

Sandoval turns towards him, "What about propulsion?"
Benedict shakes his head, "Dead. Everything's vented..."
"The firmware!" interrupts Sandoval, "The black-box! Is it still sealed?"

Sandoval's magnetic boots clang as he runs to the aft compartments. You and Benedict follow.
"The drive system logs all acceleration events for servicing and maintenance!" says Sandoval. "We can use the data to reconstruct the ship's course. That might tell us something."

Sandoval plugs into the drive system and downloads its data.
"It looks OK. I can't reconstruct it here, but I'll take it back to Fiona and we can plot a path.
"Thanks for your help, %name%. I'll tell Fiona you said hi."

Benedict is about to interject, but stops himself. He looks deflated.
Sandoval shakes his head and smiles, "Don't look like a lost little microsaur! Here, take a copy of the data and do your own analysis. We'll share what we find. Deal?"
Benedict grunts a thank you to Sandoval. He nods to you, "I'm heading towards Sanctuary. Maybe we'll meet again!"
